seniors.name: Sourabh Kumawat
seniors.poem:
In the quiet lab, where dreams would weave,
Two hearts met, on a golden eve.
Through pages turned and data traced,
Love found light in that sacred space.
Her head would rest upon my chest,
A fleeting touch, a moment blessed.
Fingers brushed, a whispered sigh,
Time stood still as love passed by.
Yet when the echoes of footsteps came,
She’d pull away, her cheeks aflame.
A stolen glance, a secret smile,
Love unspoken, yet known all the while.
Though fate may drift like waves to shore,
Some memories last forevermore.
In that last semester’s fleeting hue,
She was my love—soft, yet true.

seniors.name: Suthar shravankumar tejaram
seniors.poem:
The screen once held me, night and day,
In pixel worlds, I'd lose my way.
Quests and battles filled my mind,
Yet real-life joys were left behind.

The ticking clock, I paid no heed,
Chasing scores with endless need.
Friends grew distant, dreams stood still,
Trapped within the gaming thrill.

Then one day, I broke the chain,
Stepped outside in sun and rain.
The world was vast, so much to see,
A life beyond the games—just me.

No longer lost in endless play,
I found my path, a brighter day.
Now I live where moments last,
Not in a screen, but in my past.

seniors.name: Sk Arif
seniors.poem:
Felt a little weak, just a slight unease,
Brushed it off like a passing breeze.
But yellow eyes stared back at me,
A warning sign I failed to see.

Fatigue took over, meals felt bland,
Every sip of water tasted like sand.
Doctor’s words hit like a heavy blow,
Jaundice—nowhere else to go.

Days in bed, light too bright,
Nausea creeping in every night.
No more junk, no more fun,
Just rest and meds till the battle’s won.

Lesson learned, health comes first,
Ignoring signs makes things worse.
Slowly healed, but I now feel,
Jaundice hit hard—shit got real.

seniors.name: Aarti Nagpal
seniors.poem:
Beats of the dhol, the rhythm so tight,
Foundation Day coming, hearts feel light.
Steps in sync, the practice goes on,
Dancing till dusk, from early dawn.

Himachali Naati, a tale so grand,
Echoes of hills in every hand.
Spins so graceful, voices high,
Colors of Himachal touch the sky.

Laughter spills as mistakes we make,
Fixing the steps, no time for a break.
Energy high, the spirits soar,
Dancing like never before.

The day arrives, the crowd in cheer,
All our efforts shine so clear.
A final bow, the applause so bright,
Naati’s soul, pure delight.

seniors.name: Yadhu krishnan
seniors.poem:
Golden hues melt into the sky,
Sunsets paint the clouds so high.
Footsteps echo on quiet lanes,
Soft breeze whispers, easing pains.

Shadows stretch as twilight calls,
Campus glows in amber halls.
Silent laughter, stories untold,
Memories carved in dusk’s soft gold.

Streetlights flicker, paths unwind,
Moonlight dances, hearts aligned.
Late-night talks, the world feels light,
Dreams take flight in silver night.

Moments linger, time stands still,
Every step a gentle thrill.
Sunsets fade, but feelings stay,
Campus nights won’t drift away.
